description: PLEASE BE MINDFUL OF PRIVATE PROPERTY NEAR THE ACCESS POINT FOR THIS HIKE.PROPERTY OWNER HAS BEEN IN TOUCH TO INDICATE THEY GET UP TO 20 PEOPLE A DAY CROSSING THROUGH THEIR PROPERTY AND IT IS NOT WANTED.  PLEASE USE DESIGNATED PARKING / TRAIL ACCESS.A short hike minutes from downtown to granite bluffs overlooking the entrance to Halifax HarbourThis is a nice little hike suitable for any age.  As you leave the parking lot, the trail descends a little and continues along the shoreline.  There is no official trail but lots of small path throughout the area.  Salt damaged vegetation aboundsas well as outcrops of granite rock.  Some erratics can be viewed along the way.  there are a couple of  places where the bluffs are approximately 50ft high so be careful with your footing.  Some small areas are suitable to boulder as well.Once at the mouth of Herring Cove, retrace your steps back to your car
directions: Highway 253 from the roundabout towards herring Cove.  Parking is at  44°34'36.59"N,  63°33'2.50"W
title: Herring Cove Bluffs
